60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:11): J4k3: After you get it going, look at ck-sources
27f464a583f201bf5a66f028e826548f (14:11): there was a proggie called that and it was supposed to be nasty just like the company that it drew part of it's name from
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:11): whats ck-sources?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:11): performance tweaked kernel?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:11): J4k3: Better schedulars
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:12): this is going to be an asterisk box
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:12): when it grows up
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:12): Example.. Compiling 32bit in vmware, 64bit in 2 chroots.. 64 bit in the main system... Still had a responsive desktop
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:13): amd64 3400 with 1 gig.. Nothing out of the ordinary
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:13): I'm about to aquire a couple new systems for servers
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:14): debating either the lower end core2duo, or a 939 3800+
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:14): the 939 3800+ x2 looks like the better deal
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:14): since I can keep my 2GB of ram I already have
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:14): and double it no problem
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:14): the intel is a little more expensive, a hair faster, but requires me investing in DDR2
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:14): just remember 939 is a dead end
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:14): oh I know
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:15): I rarely ever seperate mobos and cpus
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:15): once I buy them
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:15): 754 is plenty good
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:15): with a real video card
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:15): the igps are a bit I/O bound otherwise
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:15): Semp64 754 make killer servers
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:15): Well, unless you're /. or something
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:16): Do the CoreDuos throttle the speed like and64?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:17): i like the power/heat savings
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): my p-m does too
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): I'm at 600 mhz right now iirc
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): but if I do anything, it ramps to 1.7
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): whats nice is... it'll do 1.7 on battery
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): my old XP-M 3000+ was locked to 800 mhz on battery
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:27): Yeah.. i'm just not sure if the coreduo does it
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:28): I'm not sure if the desktop version does
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:28): the laptop version does for sure
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:28): damn, gentoo is quite straightforward
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:29): somebody should take a tactical nuke to that gui "installer"

a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:30): right on
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:30): thats one thing I love about having the laptop

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:30): that's why i have problems with those that say it doesn't work...

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:30): NO SKIMMING ALLOWED!

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:32): tbh, the gui installer may eat partitions.. It doesn't support dmraid.. It's in the release notes.. Noone reads them though
842c224c189130c3429ed776e02bae7d (14:40): hey, I'm still thinking about yesterday's discussion about google name resolution

842c224c189130c3429ed776e02bae7d (14:41): I looked on their online papers, nothing about geographical HA/load-balancing solutions for name resolution. Not that much on the web also. That's frustrating
842c224c189130c3429ed776e02bae7d (14:42): but I'm quite sure they must use BGP cost path on the authoritative ns to know what IP to answer
b3ac137cc76957b079ca2a432978c49b (14:45): possible an anycast-type setup for their namservers, like like of the root-servers uses ("G", is it?)
842c224c189130c3429ed776e02bae7d (14:48): or GeoDNS, I forgot about that one
842c224c189130c3429ed776e02bae7d (14:57): yeah the anycast solution is more than probable
